channel.title: Meeting on plusmid's Blog
channel.description: Recent content in Meeting on plusmid's Blog

item.title: How to convert .zoom files on MacOS
item.description: Preface This guide explains how to convert .zoom files on MacOS. Here you can find the guides for Linux and Windows. It seems like Zoom does no longer allow you to convert the files when clicking on them. I’m assuming that you’ve installed the Zoom client using the standard way. Step 1 Open the Terminal app and change to the Zoom-Frameworks folder cd /Applications/zoom.us.app/Contents/Frameworks (you can copy-paste the command from here).

item.title: How to convert .zoom files on Ubuntu/Linux
item.description: Preface This guide explains how to convert .zoom files on Ubuntu. It should also work on other Linux distributions with minor changes. Here you can find the guides for MacOS and Windows. It seems like Zoom does no longer allow you to convert the files when clicking on them. I’m assuming that you’ve installed the Zoom client using the standard way. Step 1 Open a console and type in the command /opt/zoom/zoomlinux followed by the path to the first zoom file you want to convert.

item.title: How to convert .zoom files on Windows
item.description: Preface This guide explains how to convert .zoom files on Windows. Here you can find the guides for Linux and MacOS. It seems like Zoom does no longer allow you to convert the files just by clicking on them. I’m assuming that you’ve installed the Zoom client using the standard way. Step 1 First you need to navigate to the Zoom application directory. It will be in C:\Users\<Your user name>\AppData\Roaming\Zoom\bin, as a shortcut you can click into the path input of your Explorer and type in %appdata% and press enter.
